name: Artisan Field
biography:
1983  Artisan Field, a family-owned design firm founded in Houston, Texas. The name is derived from the definitions of "artisan...a master, technically skilled in a craft" and "field...the arena in which theories are put to practice."
Principals: James C. Boyles, President; Mary Boyles Carr and Tom Boyles, Creative Directors.
Mary Carr - B. A., Psychology, University of St. Thomas; Glassell School of Art, University of Houston.
Tom Boyles - B. A., Fine Arts (Filmmaking), Stephen F. Austin University.
Clients have included many shopping center developments and non-profit organizations
and arts institutions, such as the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston.
Present bag for Union Station is firm's only shopping bag design. Project included collateral promotional materials as well.

Source: Personal communication from Jim Boyles, March 20, 2002
